intro: Zehneria somalensis, commonly known as the Somali zehneria, is a flowering plant native to Somalia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. It produces small, bright-colored flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
